Lesson
objectives ¢ Describe the rating engine classes and

methods
* Configure the rating engine to calculate costs

for the policy

Rating engine classes and
methods

| Default Rating Engine

L

IRatingPlugin AbstractRatingEngine
A

PCRatingPlugin PARatingEngine CPRatingEngine

Calculates costs

| General rating process Gi

1. Get slices

¢ Find all dates on which anything changes in a branch and get the policy line versions (slices)
2. Rate slices

* Create CostData objects for items to be rated in slice mode (rate all or only changed slices)
3. Merge equal CostData objects

« Use the KeyValues() property to compare
4. Prorate certain CostData objects

« Update the amount field
5. Rate in window mode

* Create CostData objects that may depend on sums of other CostData objects

6. Build Costs from resulting CostData obiects and persist Costs

| Slice mode G

« Jobs change policy data across effective time
« Anew version (slice) is created each time the job edits a policy period
¢ In slice mode you view policy data as of a specific date in effective time

* When you request objects on the policy in slice mode, PolicyCenter automatically gets the
correct version of each object as of a certain date

Auto 1 Limit Cost 600/300 (720/360 «660

Auto 2 Limit Cost 720/360 ‘fo 360

# Format: TermAmount/Amount

| Which costs can be rated in slice mode?

¢ Costs that can be pro-rated based on date
¢ Cost associated is linear, increases with time

« For example, adding a vehicle or a coverage increases the premium

| Window Mode G

In window mode, all versions (slices) of policy data across all dates in effective time
can be viewed

Effective Time | 1/1 — 3/31 4/1 - 6/30 Total Tax (10%)

Premium

1020 102

# Format: TermAmount/Amount

| Which costs can be rated in window mode? Gi

¢ Costs that cannot be prorated based on dates

* Costs that are based on CostDatas created in slice mode and are usually ,
calculated at the end of rating . Example: discounts, taxes, flat rates, and minimum
premium

| AbstractRatingEngine & AbstractRatingEngineBase [5

« AbstractRatingEngine class

* Serves as a base for all LOBs in default configuration

« Provides a list of methods that must be overridden by the subclasses
¢ AbstractRatingEngineBase class

« Extend it only when rating multi-line policies one slice at a time

¢ Determines if rating should be calculated from the start of period or from the change date
forward

¢ Provides utility methods for prorating and merging costs

] Methods you must override (1 of 2)

* existingSliceModeCosts()

* Called when rating only from change date forward

« Finds any existing slice-mode costs and creates representative CostData objects
* createCostDataForCosts()

* Creates appropriate CostData subclass and returns it

* Takes cost entity instance as argument
* rateSlice()

« Rates PolicyLine viewed as a slice on a specified slice date

* Create costs for each type of premium with rating algorithms

] Methods you must override (2 of 2) G

* rateWindow()
* Rates all the window-mode costs for the PolicyLine

* Creates costs that depend on the sum of the previous slice costs or span the entire period and
rates them just once

| Rate something

Determine the start, end and rating dates
Create a new CostData object

Rating algorithm
* Set the basis
¢ Set the base rate
¢ Look up factors (optional)
* Calculate the adjusted rate
* Calculate the term amount

Add the CostData to the array
